article.headline: Loyola of Chicago 71, Valparaiso 56
article.story: CHICAGO -- Justin Cerasoli had a career-high 28 points and Loyola of Chicago won 71-56 over Valparaiso Saturday. Cerasoli scored 18 of his points in the first 12 minutes. The other Ramblers built a 29-18 lead with three minutes left. The Crusaders then outscored Loyola 8-1 over the rest of the first half. After intermission, Loyola (Horizon League, 11-8, 3-4) scored ten of the first 14 points to build a 40-30 margin. Cerasoli was backed up by J.R. Blount with 15 points and Walt Gibler with nine. Gibler hit all seven of his free throws and has made 29 of 31 from the line for the season. Aric Van Weelden also had a career-high, grabbing 11 rebounds. Valparaiso (5-14, 2-6) was playing short handed because of a knee injury to leading scorer Urule Igbavboa. Michael Rogers scored 16 points for the Crusaders, while Howard Little had 12 and Cameron Witt added 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
